intro: Habranthus longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces elongated stems that support its showy blooms. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it prefers cool and humid conditions.
